p: The statistical measurements of SGOT, GPT, ALP, and GGT levels in rat serum showed that the healthy and hepatotoxic control groups were significantly different ( p < 0.05), as listed in Tables 3 and 4. The results showed that intoxication by giving 3 g/kg BW of paracetamol has succeeded in damaging or intoxicating the liver. An increase of SGOT, SGPT, ALP and GGT activity in hepatotoxic-induced rat serum has confirmed the occurrence of liver damage due to paracetamol intoxication.
